body:
This is an extension of #84637

First and foremost, thank you @hi-rustin for fixing the original issue in #85018.

Just a quick question: Why did you create [a new file](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/44ec846f4ea68ffa6d06e7d68f078bd3cc59d4ec/src/test/ui/deprecation/issue-84637-deprecated-associated-function.rs) instead of extending [the existing one](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/44ec846f4ea68ffa6d06e7d68f078bd3cc59d4ec/src/test/ui/deprecation/suggestion.rs)?

---

While the code perfectly works for associated functions, it does not work for modules and inner functions.

Given the following code: ([Playground](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=nightly&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=64cec2378060eec66540b18a6ea9625d))

```rust
#![feature(staged_api)]
#![stable(since = "1.0.0", feature = "test")]
#![deny(deprecated)]

mod new {
    #[rustc_deprecated(since = "1.0.0", reason = "Use no", suggestion = "no")]
    #[stable(since = "1.0.0", feature = "test")]
    pub fn yes() {}
    pub fn no() {}
}

#[rustc_deprecated(since = "1.0.0", reason = "Use new", suggestion = "new")]
#[stable(since = "1.0.0", feature = "test")]
mod old {
    pub fn yes() {}
}

fn main() {
    old::yes();
    new::yes();
    new::no();
}

```

The current output is:

```
error: use of deprecated function `old::yes`: Use new
  --> src/main.rs:19:5
   |
19 |     old::yes();
   |     ^^^^^^^^ help: replace the use of the deprecated function: `new`
   |
note: the lint level is defined here
  --> src/main.rs:3:9
   |
3  | #![deny(deprecated)]
   |         ^^^^^^^^^^

error: use of deprecated function `new::yes`: Use no
  --> src/main.rs:20:5
   |
20 |     new::yes();
   |     ^^^^^^^^ help: replace the use of the deprecated function: `no`
```

Ideally the output should look like:
```
error: use of deprecated function `old::yes`: Use new
  --> src/main.rs:19:5
   |
19 |     old::yes();
   |     ^^^ help: replace the use of the deprecated function: `new`
   |
note: the lint level is defined here
  --> src/main.rs:3:9
   |
3  | #![deny(deprecated)]
   |         ^^^^^^^^^^

error: use of deprecated function `new::yes`: Use no
  --> src/main.rs:20:5
   |
20 |     new::yes();
   |          ^^^ help: replace the use of the deprecated function: `no`
```

Please note that it still says ***deprecated function***. I'm not entirely sure if `rustc_deprecated` is allowed on modules, but I guess so.

I think it should say:
```
error: use of deprecated module `old`: Use new
  --> src/main.rs:19:5
   |
19 |     old::yes();
   |     ^^^ help: replace the use of the deprecated module by: `new`
   |
```
